t: An*p oracle concerning Moab. Because*pn Ar of Moab is laid waste in a night, Moab*ld is undone; because*ln Kir of Moab is laid waste in a night, Moab*ld is undone.
He*ln has gone up to the temple, and to Dibon, to*ld the high places to weep; over*ln Nebo and over Medeba Moab*ld wails. On*ln every head is baldness; every*ld beard is shorn;
in*ln the streets they wear sackcloth; on*ld the housetops and in the squares everyone*ld wails and melts in tears.
Heshbon*ln and Elealeh cry out; their*ld voice is heard as far as Jahaz; therefore*ln the armed men of Moab cry aloud; his*ld soul trembles.

My*ln heart cries out for Moab; her*ld fugitives flee to Zoar, to*ld Eglath-shelishiyah. For*ln at the ascent of Luhith they*ld go up weeping; on*ln the road to Horonaim they*ld raise a cry of destruction;
the*ln waters of Nimrim are*ld a desolation; the*ln grass is withered, the vegetation fails, the*ld greenery is no more.
Therefore*ln the abundance they have gained and*ld what they have laid up they*ln carry away over*ld the Brook of the Willows.
For*ln a cry has gone around*ld the land of Moab; her*ln wailing reaches to Eglaim; her*ld wailing reaches to Beer-elim.
For*ln the waters of Dibon are full of blood; for*ld I will bring upon Dibon even more, a*ln lion for those of Moab who escape, for*ld the remnant of the land.
